dcterms:creator: C. A. Jordan
M. Cetin
R. M. Robinson
dcterms:description: The Vanilla Jordan controller is designed for path clearance for emergency vehicles through vehicle-to-vehicle communication, optimizing the movement of vehicles to facilitate the passage of EMS vehicles.
dcterms:title: Vanilla Jordan controller

dcterms:creator: C. Wu
A. R. Kreidieh
K. Parvate
E. Vinitsky
A. M. Bayen
dcterms:description: The Flow framework is a modular learning framework for mixed autonomy traffic, facilitating the development and testing of control strategies for connected and automated vehicles.
dcterms:title: Flow framework

dcterms:creator: P. A. Lopez
M. Behrisch
L. Bieker-Walz
J. Erdmann
Y.-P. Flötteröd
R. Hilbrich
L. Lücken
J. Rummel
P. Wagner
E. Wießner
dcterms:description: SUMO is a microscopic traffic simulator that allows for the simulation of traffic scenarios, enabling the analysis of traffic flow and vehicle interactions in various settings.
dcterms:title: SUMO microscopic traffic simulator

dcterms:creator: H. Treiber
D. Hennecke
D. Helbing
dcterms:description: The Intelligent Driver Model (IDM) is a car-following model that simulates the behavior of human drivers in traffic, capturing the dynamics of vehicle interactions.
dcterms:title: Intelligent Driver Model (IDM)

dcterms:creator: C. A. Jordan
M. Cetin
R. M. Robinson
dcterms:description: Shockwave theory provides a framework for understanding traffic flow dynamics, particularly in the context of emergency vehicle clearance and the impact on surrounding traffic.
dcterms:title: Shockwave theory
